text:
Hello! Hello! It´s just an empty room with
a door and a window. Oh dear. Hello! Oh, hello

children. Hi. Let´s learn some English. But…
Oh dear, I don´t know what to do. I am in

an empty room with a door and a window. And
a table. Where did that come from? Oh look,

it´s a table. So say with me. It´s a table.
It´s a table. It´s a table. Yeah. It´s

a table.
How strange. A table. Who… what… how…

Oh well, look, it´s a table. Hey, what...
how… what´s that? Hey, what is it? Oh look,

it´s a radio. Wow! A radio. What is it? It´s
a radio. Say with me. It´s a radio. It´s

a radio. It´s a radio. Again. It´s a radio.
Look, there is a table and a radio in this

empty room. What´s going on?
Look! Yeah! It´s a chair. Say with me. It´s

a chair. Come on. It´s a chair. What is it?
It´s a chair. Again. It´s a chair. Yeah!

But hey… first there was a table… then
a radio… then a chair. What´s next? What

is it? Oh look, it´s a carpet. Say with me.
It´s a carpet. It´s a carpet. What is it?

It´s a carpet. Again. It´s a carpet.
Well, let me put this back. That´s better.

Oh! Oh no! Got it! Great. But, oh dear, I
need some help. Where is Maggie? Maggie! Maggie!

Coming Steve. Hey, what are you doing?
Well, I am holding a carpet.

Why? A carpet goes on the floor. Silly Steve.
Yes Maggie.

That´s better. And the chair goes behind
the table.

Yes Maggie. I know.
Silly silly Steve.

Oh well, at least you can now say table…
Yeah!

…radio…
Yeah!

…chair…
Yeah!

…and carpet.
Yeah!
